content: Any objection to folks building projects on top of wasmtime using this zulip to create a stream for their project? I've got something built on wasmtime-go that I'd like to have chat for without setting up something of my own.

not at all! As long as you're comfortable being bound by the BA's CoC (which is the Contributors Covenant), and as long as they have a clear relation to the BA or its projects, you're more than welcome to create project- or use case-specific channels

Great, thanks. Just created #fastlike.dev. The project (https://github.com/avidal/fastlike) is a Fastly Compute emulator/runtime written in Go.

avidal/fastlike
Run Fastly Compute@Edge Wasm programs on your own computer, powered by wasmtime - avidal/fastlike
I created a stream for wasi-nn discussion, the Neural Network proposal for WASI.
